extent: The 7th Marines are on a key mission in central Iraq
Sentence: CROWLEY The 7th Marines are on a key mission in central Iraq .

extent: They are fanning out to villages and towns in the region to search for paramilitary groups that might attack the vital coalition supply lines
Sentence: They are fanning out to villages and towns in the region to search for paramilitary groups that might attack the vital coalition supply lines .

extent: Instead of just patrolling the highways, they are heading into the villages and towns in this region, trying to find out if there are any hideouts or headquarters for the paramilitary units that have been striking at supply lines and striking at U.S. military forces

extent: The U.S. Marines
Sentence: ( BEGIN VIDEOTAPE ) MARTIN SAVIDGE , CNN CORRESPONDENT The U.S. Marines here who have been involved for days trying to patrol and secure the supply lines that reach all the way back to northern Kuwait have now taken a more proactive stance .

extent: Marines on foot in place on the other side
Sentence: As these loud rumbling APCs moved in on one side of the village , before daylight , there were already Marines on foot in place on the other side , prepared to catch anybody that might fleeing from the other direction .

extent: When the Marines got into town, though, it wasn't a matter of just kicking down doors and looking for people
Sentence: When the Marines got into town , though , it was n't a matter of just kicking down doors and looking for people .

extent: the senior elder in the village

mentionArg1.extent: the senior elder in the village

Sentence: Instead , it took a much more subtle approach , trying to find the senior elder in the village , or the sheikh , to talk to him , realizing that he 'd be the senior person and probably the best in the know .

extent: that had been active in this area
Sentence: He put their minds not totally at easy , but did seem to satisfy them that he said the paramilitary units that had been active in this area had already left , and had done so days ago .

extent: Iraqi soldiers
Sentence: It seems Iraqi soldiers , a number of days ago , had shut off the water supply to their little town .

extent: their little town

extent: the average Iraqi people

extent: the dangerous landscape of Iraq
Sentence: ( END VIDEOTAPE ) ( NEWSBREAK ) CROWLEY Ten million , that 's the number of land mines believed hidden in the dangerous landscape of Iraq .

extent: British military engineers
Sentence: British military engineers are among those charged with the task of digging them up and clearing the way for advancing coalition forces .

extent: CNN's Richard Blystone
Sentence: CNN 's Richard Blystone says it 's a job that requires skill , patience , and as you may imagine , a very gentle touch .

extent: 10 million Iraqi laid mines
Sentence: The coalition says its forces are n't using mines now , but the engineers say there may be 10 million Iraqi laid mines around Iraq .

extent: British engineers are charged with clearing living and working space in southern Iraq for troops, aid workers, and Iraqi civilians, and marking off danger areas with signs that look uncomfortably like grave markers
